articles.title: Astronauts will be 'living and working on the moon' within a decade, says NASA - Sky News
articles.content:
NASA plans to have astronauts working and living on the moon for up to two months within a decade.

articles.author: Fiona Jackson
articles.title: T.rex was 70% larger than previously thought and could weigh up to 33,000lbs, study claims - Daily Mail
articles.description: Researchers from the Canadian Museum of Nature built a model that predicted the maximum size of a T. Rex, but warn it is speculative until a specimen of this size is discovered.
articles.content:
The infamous Tyrannosaurus Rex - or T. rex - could have weighed up to 33,000lb (15,000 kg) when it roamed the Earth.
This is just over the weight of two elephants, or a London double-decker bus, and… [+4787 chars]

articles.title: Scroll through the UNIVERSE: Incredible interactive map lets you explore 200,000 galaxies - Daily Mail
articles.description: Researchers from Johns Hopkins gathered two decades worth of data to create this stunning interactive map of the observable Universe.
articles.content:
Space fans no longer have to rely on science fiction or wait for pictures beamed back from the James Webb Space Telescope to explore the deepest edges of the universe.

articles.title: The Red Planet was once BLUE: Mars was covered by 984ft-deep oceans 4.5 billion years ago - Daily Mail
articles.description: A new study led by researchers from the University of Copenhagen has revealed that 4.5 billion years ago, Mars was covered by 984ft (300 metre)-deep oceans.
articles.content:
Now a desolate red desert, a new study has claimed that Mars was once actually predominantly blue.

articles.title: James Webb telescope finds two of the oldest and most distant galaxies ever seen - The Guardian

articles.content:
